statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: St. Peter's 80, Rider 60
article.story: JERSEY CITY, N.J. -- Ryan Bacon had 22 points, 12 rebounds and three steals to lead Saint Peter's over Rider 80-60 on Saturday. Darius Conley, Steven Samuels, Wesley Jenkins and Brandon Hall tallied two steals each as the Peacock's (13-9, 8-3 Metro Atlantic Athletic Association) had 13 takeaways. Leading 50-48 Saint Peter's scored seven straight, culminating in Jenkins' 3-pointer after a steal with 8:56 to play. The Broncs (15-8, 7-4) had 20 turnovers, leading to 23 points by Saint Peter's. Jeron Belin also had a double-double for the Peacocks with 15 points and 11 rebounds, as they outrebounded Rider 41-33. Steven Samuels added 13 points and Jenkins finished with 11 for Saint Peter's, which won its fourth straight. Justin Robinson led the Broncs with 16 points. Brandon Penn and Danny Stewart added 11 points each for Rider, which had a three-game winning streak snapped.
